result.execSummary:
The defendant Drequarell Tharpe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. Huber for work, school, and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation. If revoked, by DOC, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain full time employment.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

No contact with drug community.
No contact with the victim Charles C. and Co-actors: D.T., A.W.

Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive behavior therapy.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.  
No positive results.
No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Drequarell Tharpe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Defendant's pro se request for sentence modification.
Decision and Order Denying Request for Sentence Modification, filed and signed by the Court.  The defendant's request for sentence modification is denied.  Copies forwarded to parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for sentence reduction.
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Drequarell Tharpe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Lucy Kronforst for Benjamin Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement by:  Teretta L.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 6 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim Charles C. and Co-actors: D.T., A.W. 
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation. If revoked, by DOC, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Received and filed:  Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Drequarell Tharpe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant provided employment and school verification.  Court takes no action at this time.   Defendant to provide hospital discharge documentation at sentencing on July 27, 2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 26.

Defendant Drequarell Tharpe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  James C. Griffin for Benjamin Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court lifts stayed warrant.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Restitution to be determined at sentencing.  Court adjourned remand of defendant until 7/10/2015 at 8:30 am.  Defendant to provide the Court with proof of school enrollment, hospital release documentation and proof of employment.   Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 26.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court.  Lucy Kronforst for Benjamin Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next scheduled hearing.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26,  Plea hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Drequarell Tharpe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Projected guilty plea hearing.  Defense counsel just received an offer and requests new date.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Drequarell Tharpe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense received discovery.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant Drequarell Tharpe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and filed.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.

Defendant Drequarell Tharpe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Paul Hauer for Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed. Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/13/15.
HMP

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CHARLES C., ANTHONY W., DARNELL T. (10/27/98), AND DONGON S. 
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Drequarell Tharpe in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Drequarell Tharpe in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge POCAN, Branch 26.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
